actor_awards.notes: Won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for 'The Barefoot Contessa' (1954). He was a versatile character actor known for his roles in film noir, including the lead in the classic 'D.O.A.'.

filmography.title: The Barefoot Contessa
filmography.role_description: A sweating, nervous, and sycophantic publicist who narrates the rise and fall of a Spanish dancer.
filmography.plot: A Spanish dancer becomes a Hollywood star, but her life is tragic despite her fame and wealth.

filmography.title: Seven Days in May
filmography.role_description: An alcoholic senator from Georgia who is recruited to investigate a potential military coup.
filmography.plot: United States military leaders plot to overthrow the President because he supports a nuclear disarmament treaty and they fear a Soviet sneak attack.

filmography.title: D.O.A.
filmography.role_description: An accountant who discovers he has been poisoned with a slow-acting toxin and spends his final hours hunting for his own killer.
filmography.plot: A man reports his own murder to the police and recounts the story of how he was poisoned and his frantic search for the killer.

filmography.title: The Wild Bunch
filmography.role_description: The grizzled, cackling old member of the outlaw gang who is left behind to tend the horses but survives to tell the tale.
filmography.plot: An aging group of outlaws look for one last big score as the 'traditional' American West is disappearing around them.

filmography.title: White Heat
filmography.role_description: A federal agent who goes undercover in prison to befriend a psychopathic gangster and infiltrate his gang.
filmography.plot: A psychopathic criminal with a mother complex makes a daring escape from prison and leads his old gang in a chemical plant payroll heist.

filmography.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
filmography.role_description: The drunken, courageous, and eloquent newspaper editor of the Shinbone Star who stands up for the truth.
filmography.plot: A senator returns to a western town for the funeral of an old friend and tells the truth about his deed.

filmography.title: The Killers
filmography.role_description: A dogged insurance investigator who becomes obsessed with uncovering the reason a former boxer accepted his murder without a struggle.
filmography.plot: Hit men kill an unresisting victim, and an insurance investigator unravels the man's past betrayal by a beautiful woman.

filmography.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
filmography.role_description: A poet and philosopher who marries Esmeralda to save her from execution. O'Brien's film debut.
filmography.plot: A deformed bell-ringer falls in love with a beautiful gypsy girl and tries to save her from the corrupt officials of Paris.

filmography.title: Julius Caesar
filmography.role_description: One of the conspirators against Caesar, known for being the first to stab him.
filmography.plot: The growing ambition of Julius Caesar is a source of major concern to his close friend Brutus and a group of conspirators.

filmography.role_description: The disillusioned protagonist living under the oppressive regime of Big Brother in the first film adaptation of Orwell's novel.
filmography.plot: In a totalitarian future society, a man whose daily work is rewriting history tries to rebel by falling in love.

filmography.title: The Hitch-Hiker
filmography.role_description: One of two fishing buddies held hostage by a psychotic hitchhiker in this tense noir thriller directed by Ida Lupino.
filmography.plot: Two fishermen pick up a psychopathic escaped convict who tells them that he intends to kill them when the ride is over.

filmography.title: Birdman of Alcatraz
filmography.role_description: The author and biographer who brings the story of Robert Stroud to the world's attention.
filmography.plot: A surly convicted murderer held in permanent isolation redeems himself when he becomes a renowned bird expert.

filmography.title: The Girl Can't Help It
filmography.role_description: A slot-machine kingpin who hires a press agent to turn his talentless girlfriend into a singing star.
filmography.plot: A gangster hires a down-and-out press agent to make his blonde bombshell girlfriend a recording star in six weeks.

filmography.title: A Double Life
filmography.role_description: A press agent who becomes suspicious of an actor who is losing his grip on reality while playing Othello.
filmography.plot: An actor's life mirrors the characters he plays, leading to tragedy when he takes on the role of Othello.

filmography.title: Fantastic Voyage
filmography.role_description: The military general who oversees the top-secret shrinking mission from the control room.
filmography.plot: A scientist is nearly assassinated. In order to save him, a submarine is shrunken to microscopic size and injected into his blood stream with a small crew.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Art Direction, Best Special Visual Effects

filmography.title: The Bigamist
filmography.role_description: A traveling salesman who finds himself married to two women in two different cities.
filmography.plot: A man falls in love with and marries a woman while still married to another woman.

filmography.title: 711 Ocean Drive
filmography.role_description: A telephone repairman who uses his technical skills to rise in the world of illegal bookmaking.
filmography.plot: A telephone repairman uses his knowledge of electronics to help a bookie set up a wire service for betting on horse races.

filmography.title: The Web
filmography.role_description: An ambitious lawyer who gets framed for murder by a wealthy industrialist.
filmography.plot: A wealthy industrialist hires a lawyer as a bodyguard, but it's a setup to frame him for murder.

filmography.title: The Great Impostor
filmography.role_description: A Canadian naval officer who investigates the credentials of the impostor Ferdinand Demara.
filmography.plot: The true story of Ferdinand Waldo Demara Jr., who successfully impersonated a naval surgeon, a prison warden, and a monk.

filmography.title: Rio Conchos
filmography.role_description: A Confederate colonel who refuses to surrender and plans to sell stolen rifles to Apaches.
filmography.plot: An ex-Confederate major and a Mexican bandit are forced to lead a mission to recover stolen rifles.

filmography.title: The Third Voice
filmography.role_description: A man who plots to murder a wealthy businessman and impersonate him on the telephone to steal his fortune.
filmography.plot: A man murders a wealthy businessman and then impersonates his voice on the telephone to steal his money.

filmography.title: Up Periscope
filmography.role_description: A strict submarine commander who clashes with a Frogman during a dangerous WWII mission.
filmography.plot: A Navy Frogman is assigned to a submarine to photograph a code book on a Japanese-held island.

filmography.title: The Last Voyage
filmography.role_description: An engineer on an ocean liner who tries to help the captain save passengers when the ship begins to sink.
filmography.plot: The boiler room of an aging ocean liner explodes, and the captain struggles to save the passengers as the ship sinks.

filmography.title: Sylvia
filmography.role_description: A wealthy man who hires a private investigator to look into the past of his fiancée.
filmography.plot: A private investigator falls in love with the woman he is investigating, discovering a life of tragedy and abuse.

filmography.title: An Eye for an Eye
filmography.role_description: An aging bounty hunter who teams up with a younger gunfighter to track down a gang of outlaws.
filmography.plot: Two bounty hunters with a grudge against the same gang team up to track them down.
